title: The Respect Issue
text:
The Respect Issue is the second album by American metalcore band <a href="Emmure">Emmure</a>. The album was released on May 13, 2008, with pre-orders available on March 11. <a href="Kurt%20Angle">Kurt Angle</a>, <a href="professional%20wrestler">professional wrestler</a> and former <a href="Wrestling%20at%20the%20Summer%20Olympics">Olympic wrestler</a>, is featured as a <a href="boxer">boxer</a> on the cover art and throughout the inlay. Angle also wore an Emmure shirt during broadcasts of "<a href="TNA%20Impact%21">TNA Impact!</a>" in promotion of the album. This is also the last studio release to feature founding members Ben and Joe Lionetti, who left the band in May 2009.
It debuted at number 141 in the <a href="Billboard%20200">"Billboard" 200</a>, selling over 5,000 copies.
Snuff 2: The Resurrection refers to a quote that Max California (played by <a href="Joaquin%20Phoenix">Joaquin Phoenix</a>) in the 1999 film "<a href="8MM%20%28film%29">8MM</a>".
